page.title: 01MIDDLETON IN WARWICKSHIRE
page.content: Middleton in l985 is a mainly agricultural area, with the land being owned by five large farming concerns who have absorbed the assets of the smaller farms, retaining the land whilst selling the buildings for private dwellings. Although the majority of the land around Middleton is listed as 'grade 2 - arable', much of the area to the south-east is rich in gravel bearing strata, and this is now being extracted. Less than 1% of the area's population work locally, the majority of inhabitants finding places for employment, social activities and the purchase of domestic goods in the nearby towns of Birmingham, Sutton Coldfield, Tamworth and Coleshill. Although the areas has a Public House, Village Hall and two shops, the bulk of facilities are supplied from outside the area.
